thread.title: City Council designates Newton a ‘welcoming city’ for immigrants
thread.title_full: City Council designates Newton a ‘welcoming city’ for immigrants

title: City Council designates Newton a ‘welcoming city’ for immigrants

organizations.name: boston globe by the boston globe

text:
City Council designates Newton a ‘welcoming city’ for immigrants City Council designates Newton a ‘welcoming city’ for immigrants Ralliers called for Newton to become a "Welcoming City," outside Newton City Hall on Tuesday. –John Blanding / Boston Globe By The Boston Globe 9:10 AM 
After weeks of debate and rallies in support of immigrants, the Newton City Council on Tuesday voted 16 to 1 to become a “welcoming city” that protects all residents, regardless of their legal status. 
Seven councilors were absent from the packed meeting, which followed a rally attended by more than 150 people who held signs, wore buttons, and cheered to show their support for immigrants and refugees. 
Read the complete story at BostonGlobe.com .
